evaluated_questions.cited_paragraph: In C++, local variables are declared within a function or method, while global variables are declared outside of any function, typically at the beginning of the program.

evaluated_questions.question: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
evaluated_questions.reason: The answer accurately articulates the key difference between while and do...while loops.
evaluated_questions.cited_paragraph: The primary difference between a while loop and a do...while loop is that the do...while loop will always execute its block of code at least once, regardless of the condition, while the while loop may not execute if the condition is false initially.

evaluated_questions.reason: The student accurately distinguishes between the two types of loops, explaining the unique condition of the do...while structure clearly.
